revision.text:
{{pp-30-500|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox non-profit | name = Im Tirtzu | image = [[File:Im tirtzu logo 40pc.png|220px]] | type = [[Non-governmental organization]] | founded_date = 2006<ref name="Im Tirtzu movement" /> | tax_id = | registration_id = 580471662<ref>{{cite web |url=https://imti.org.il/en/sp_faq/is-im-tirtzu-a-registered-association-in-the-state-of-israel/?lang=en |title=Is Im Tirtzu a registered association in the State of Israel? |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> | founder = | location = | coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LAT|LON|display=inline,title}} --> | origins = | key_people = [[Ronen Shoval]] (Founder)<ref name=contact>{{cite web |url=https://imti.org.il/en/about-us/council/ |title=Public Council |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> Matan Peleg (CEO)<ref>{{cite web|title=Staff|url=https://imti.org.il/en/about-us/staff/|website=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> | area_served = Israel | product = | mission = "to strengthen and advance the values of Zionism in Israel"<ref name="itOfficial">{{cite web |title=Is Im Tirtzu a political party? |publisher=Im Tirtzu |url=https://imti.org.il/en/sp_faq/is-im-tirtzu-a-political-party/?lang=en}}</ref> | focus = | method = | revenue = | endowment = | num_volunteers = | num_employees = | num_members = | subsid = | owner = | non-profit_slogan = "Building the Zionist dream" | former name = | homepage = https://imti.org.il/en | dissolved = | footnotes = }} '''Im Tirtzu''' ([[Hebrew language|Hebrew]]: אם תרצו, lit. 'If you will it') is a [[Zionism|Zionist]]<ref>{{cite news |author=Abe Selig |date=2 February 2010 |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/New-Israel-Fund-comes-out-swinging-against-Im-Tirtzu-report |title=New Israel Fund comes out swinging against Im Tirtzu report |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |accessdate=20 November 2013}}</ref><ref name=nyt20151216>{{cite news |author=Robert Mackley |title=Group Calls Israelis 'Foreign Agents' for Work on Behalf of Palestinians |date=16 December 2015 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/16/world/middleeast/group-calls-israelis-foreign-agents-for-work-on-behalf-of-palestinians.html |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> [[non-governmental organization]] based in Israel.<ref name="Im Tirtzu movement">{{cite web |title=About Us|url=https://imti.org.il/en/about-us/movement/ |publisher=Im Tirtzu |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref> Its name is derived from an [[epigraph (literature)|epigraph]] appended to the frontespiece of [[Theodor Herzl]]'s novel [[Altneuland]], 'if you wish it, it is no fairy-tale,' rendered into [[modern Hebrew]] in [[Nahum Sokolow]]'s translation in 1903, as ''Im tirtzu ein zo agadah.'' ("If you will it, it is no dream.")<ref>Fiammetta Martegani, [https://books.google.com/books?id=gVwpDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA52 ''The Israeli Defence Forces’ Representation in Israeli Cinema: Did David Betray His Soldiers?,''] Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2017 p.52.</ref><ref>Denis Charbit (ed.), Theodor Herzl,[https://books.google.com/books?id=RZbJi3fLTNAC&pg=PA16 ''Altneuland: nouveau pays ancient,''], tr L.Delau, éditions de l’éclat, 2004 pp-16-17.</ref>
On its establishment in 2006, the organization stated that its mission was to renew "Zionist discourse, Zionist thinking and Zionist ideology to ensure the future of the Jewish nation and the State of Israel."<ref name="NPNG" >Nicola Perugini, [[Neve Gordon]], [https://books.google.com/books?id=F8n9CAAAQBAJ&pg=PT69 ''The Human Right to Dominate,''] [[Oxford University Press]], 2015 p.59.</ref> Claiming to "strengthen and advance the values of Zionism in Israel", it sees itself as dedicated to combating a "campaign of de-legitimization against the State of Israel and to [provide] responses to [[Post-Zionism|Post-Zionist]] and [[Anti-Zionism| Anti-Zionist]] phenomena".<ref name="Im Tirtzu movement" /> Im Tirtzu is mostly known for its campaigns against the [[New Israel Fund]], foreign government-funded NGOs, and alleged bias in the [[curriculum|curricula]] of Israeli universities. According to critics, Im Tirtzu's strategies focus on delegitimizing Israeli left and human-rights groups and driving a wedge between them and their funding sources.<ref name="NPNG" /><ref>Katherine Natanel, [https://books.google.com/books?id=RbQwDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA170 ''Sustaining Conflict: Apathy and Domination in Israel-Palestine,''] [[University of California Press]] 2016 pp.170-171, p.209 n.5:‘Deemed fascist and McCarthyist by Ha’aretz journalist Gideon Levy, Im Tirtzu is a right-wing extra-parliamentary organization which “works to strengthen and advance the values of Zionism in Israel.”: it does so in part through targeting academics, institutions, and organizations deemed ‘anti-Zionist’ by its own estimation.'</ref>
Im Tirtzu operates fifteen branches at universities and colleges throughout the country<ref name="Im Tirtzu movement" /> and runs the largest Zionist academic extra-curricular program in Israel.<ref name="jpost.com">{{cite news |author=Lidar Gravé-Lazi |date=29 June 2016 |title=Boosting Zionist education – within Israel |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Boosting-Zionist-education-within-Israel-459097 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref> Some have maintained that Im Tirtzu bears similarities to fascist groups,<ref name="Hasson"/><ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite news |title=Court to rule on anti-Im Tirzu Facebook page |author=Joanna Paraszczuk |date=13 February 2012 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |url=http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Court-to-rule-on-anti-Im-Tirzu-Facebook-page}}</ref> and others have labelled it an important Zionist movement.<ref name="youtube.com">{{cite AV media |title=PM Netanyahu's message to 'Im Tirtzu' supporters |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4nSxRPGCRew |via=YouTube |accessdate=3 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite AV media |title=Nobel Prize Laureate Yisrael Aumann Congratulating IMTI's Program for Zionist Thought |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UbrJ-gjD8I0&index=1&list=PLVLWOBzqoMSsrCkNvWBGGD1eK7wiK4DSy |via=YouTube |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref> Im Tirtzu has received wide support from the Israeli government.<ref>{{cite web|title="Im Tirtzu" Celebrated a Decade of Activity|url=http://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/502095|website=Israel Hayom|accessdate=23 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The Minister of the State of Israel and the Prime Minister Congratulate Im Tirtzu|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i6yrEVsG0Jo|website=YouTube}}</ref> ==Overview== Im Tirtzu was set up in 2006, and soon was closely meshed with a network of other bodies, new and old, such as [[The Legal Forum for the Land of Israel]], [[My Israel|Israel Sheli]], [[Institute for Zionist Strategies]], and [[NGO Monitor]], organized to further Zionist aims.<ref>[[Naomi Chazan]], 'Israel and the World: The Democracy Factor,' [https://books.google.com/books?id=nBbFw6hb_68C&pg=PA80 ''Israel in the World: Legitimacy and Exceptionalism,''] [[Routledge]], 2013 pp.73-96 p.80.</ref> It was little known until February 2010 when it made headlines with a claim that Israeli NGOs, esp. the [[New Israel Fund]], were in good part responsible for the damage to Israel’s international standing that resulted from the publication of the [[Goldstone Report]] regarding the [[Gaza War (2008–09)|conduct of the 2008-2009 Gaza War]]. Some three months later, [[Kadima]] led by [[Ronit Tirosh]], together with right wing parties, proposed a bill to outlaw any NGO that furnished foreign or international organizations with information that might buttress accusations of war crimes by either Israel or the [[Israeli Defense Forces|IDF]]. <ref>Nathan Jeffay,[https://forward.com/news/127974/kadima-bill-ngos-that-assist-in-war-crime-accusat/ Kadima Bill: NGOs That Assist in War Crime Accusations Should Be Illegal] [[The Forward]] 12 May 2010</ref>
== Activity == === Alleging politicization in academia === ==== Ben-Gurion University ==== In 2008, Im Tirtzu published a report about the syllabuses used in various academic departments in Israel. According to the report, authors who reject the notion of nationality, or support [[Anti-Zionism|anti-Zionist]] views, get much more exposure in reading lists. In 2010, Im Tirtzu sent Rivka Karmi, the head of the [[Ben-Gurion University of the Negev]] a letter, demanding that the university stop the anti-Zionist bias in its Department of Politics and Government. The letter alleged that 9 out of 11 professors in the department were involved in extreme left-wing activities (among others, attempting to persuade other countries to join the [[academic boycott of Israel]]). Im Tirtzu threatened to notify the donors of the university if the problem was not rectified.<ref>{{cite news |author=Amit Barak |date=5 December 2011 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |url=http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Op-Ed-Contributors/An-open-letter-to-the-president-of-Ben-Gurion-University |title=An open letter to the president of Ben-Gurion University |accessdate=8 January 2013}}</ref>
In a joint statement about the above campaign, the heads of Israel's seven leading universities urged condemnation of what they called Im Tirtzu's "dangerous attempt to create a thought police".<ref name=IPS1>{{cite news |author=[[Jerrold Kessel]] |author2=Pierre Klochendler |url=http://www.ipsnews.net/2010/08/mideast-mccarthyism-rises-in-israel/ |title='McCarthyism' Rises in Israel |publisher=[[Inter Press Service]] |date=26 August 2010}}</ref> Im Tirtzu responded, "All Im Tirtzu asked from BGU is that a solution be found to the extreme bias found in the Political Science department, where only [[Post-Zionism|post-Zionist]] opinions are presented."<ref>{{cite news |author=Dan Illouz |date=23 August 2010 |url=http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Op-Ed-Contributors/McCarthyism-and-post-Zionism |title=McCarthyism and post-Zionism |work=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
Following Im Tirtzu's report, the Israeli Council for Higher Education appointed an international committee to investigate the allegations. The committee came to the conclusion that the curriculum in the Political Science department was imbalanced. The committee said it was "concerned that the study of politics as a scientific discipline may be impeded by such strong emphasis on political activism", and recommended closing the department unless changes were made.<ref>{{cite news |author=Tamar Trabelsi-Hadad |date=23 November 2011 |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4152161,00.html|title=Recommendation: Shut down 'leftist' department |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] }}</ref> The report was widely criticized by academics, who said that it was politically motivated, noting that well-known scholars had been rejected from the committee because of their political views and that the original committee chair had resigned.<ref>{{Cite news |work=[[Haaretz]] |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/international-academics-seek-to-keep-biased-department-at-israeli-university-open-1.402450 |date=20 December 2011 |title=International academics seek to keep 'biased' department at Israeli university open |first=Talila |last=Nesher}}</ref> Minister of Education, [[Gideon Sa'ar]], said "I believe the report is important since it encourages public discussion" but rejected any attempts to block or apply conditions for donations to Israeli universities.<ref>{{cite journal |publisher=[[Coalition of Women for Peace]] |title=All-Out War: Israel Against Democracy |date=November 2010 |page=33 |url=http://coalition.s482.sureserver.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/12/AllOutWar-internet-ENG.pdf}}</ref><ref name=jp20101018>{{cite news |author=Ron Friedman |title=Right-wing group Im Tirzu threatens BGU donations|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Right-wing-group-Im-Tirzu-threatens-BGU-donations |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=18 October 2010}}</ref>
In 2016 Im Tirtzu alleged that Ben-Gurion University was sponsoring a conference featuring the CEO and public relations coordinator of [[Breaking the Silence (non-governmental organization)|Breaking the Silence]] in violation of a ruling by Israel's Council for Higher Education against politicizing academia.<ref>{{cite news |author=Lea Speyer |date=20 May 2016 |title=Watchdog: Ben-Gurion University Actively Supporting Delegitimization of Israel With Sponsorship of Conference Featuring Breaking the Silence |url=https://www.algemeiner.com/2016/05/20/watchdog-ben-gurion-university-actively-supporting-delegitimization-of-israel-with-sponsorship-of-breaking-the-silence-conference/ |newspaper=[[Algemeiner Journal]]}}</ref> The University denied claims of politicization and responded that it is a "pluralistic academic institution, which promotes and enables an open and diverse dialogue and does not seek to espouse a particular political viewpoint".<ref>{{cite news |author=David Israel |date=18 May 2016 |title=Ben-Gurion University Sponsoring 'Breaking the Silence' Event (Updated)|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/ben-gurion-university-sponsoring-breaking-the-silence-event/2016/05/18/|newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]]}}</ref>
In response to the conference, a prominent donor and longstanding member of the university's board of governors announced that he was withholding a donation of $1 million due to the conference. The university responded that they were unaware of such a pledge.<ref>{{cite news |author=Lidar Gravé-Lazi |date=27 May 2016 |title=Donor Withholds $1M. From BGU over Breaking the Silence Panel |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Donor-withholds-1m-from-BGU-over-Breaking-the-Silence-panel-455179 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] }}</ref>
==== Haifa University legal clinics ==== In 2013 Im Tirtzu released a report alleging "severe politicization" of the legal clinics at the University of Haifa. According to the report, 80% of the cases treated by the clinics dealt with security prisoners, among those convicted of terrorism and espionage.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Kalman Liebskind]] |date=3 November 2013 |title=כך פועלת אונ' חיפה למען ייצוג מחבלים |language=he |trans-title=This is How Haifa University Works for Terrorists |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART2/518/845.html |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]}}</ref>
The report charged that certain clinics of the University are part of the "Arab nationalist struggle against Zionism" and "cooperate with organizations that oppose the existence of the State of Israel as a democratic state".<ref>{{cite news |date=3 November 2013 |title=Im Tirtzu: University of Haifa legal clinics are politicized |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=13065 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref>
Following the report, then Minister of Education [[Shai Piron]] together with the [[Council for Higher Education in Israel]] commissioned an international committee of experts to investigate the clinics. In 2016, the committee published its recommendations that matched "virtually all of the conclusions from the Im Tirtzu report".<ref>{{cite news |title=Im Tirtzu: Decision to investigate legal clinics 'historic' step |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/218197|publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref>
==== Hebrew University's Minerva Center for Human Rights ==== Following numerous media reports citing Im Tirtzu's criticism of a Minerva Center program that offers students four academic credits and a scholarship in exchange for interning eight hours per week at a human rights organization, a group of bereaved families penned a letter to Education Minister [[Naftali Bennett]] calling on him to investigate the program.<ref name="JPost Bereaved Families">{{cite news |author=Lidar Gravé-Lazi |date=19 October 2016 |title=Exclusive: Bereaved Families Call Hebrew U. Human Rights Program 'Anti-Israel' |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Exclusive-Bereaved-families-call-Hebrew-U-human-rights-program-anti-Israel-470381 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
According to the bereaved families, they were "horrified" to learn that the program allows for internship at organizations including [[B'Tselem]], [[HaMoked]] and [[Public Committee Against Torture in Israel]], which they called "anti-Israel" organizations.<ref name="JPost Bereaved Families" />
At a Knesset Education Committee that was convened to discuss the program, Hebrew University's legal advisor Pepi Yakirevich stated: "The program asks of students to volunteer 8 weekly hours in human rights organizations that the Law Faculty sees of holding high importance.... Do you expect for the Hebrew University to act as a content filter? At the moment there is no red line."<ref>{{cite news |date=27 December 2016 |author=Eliran Karsenty |title=ההורים השכולים זעקו: "מתירים את דם יקירנו" |language=he |trans-title=The Cry of the Bereaved Families: They are Permitting the Blood of our Loved Ones |url=http://www.20il.co.il/%D7%9B%D7%AA%D7%91%D7%AA-%D7%95%D7%99%D7%93%D7%90%D7%95-%D7%94%D7%95%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%A9%D7%9B%D7%95%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%A0%D7%92%D7%93-%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%92-%D7%AA%D7%92%D7%9E/ |publisher=[[Channel 20 (Israel)|Channel 20]]}}</ref>
==== American Anthropological Association boycott vote ==== In 2016 Im Tirtzu released a report alleging the involvement of Israeli academics in the proposed resolution of the [[American Anthropological Association]] (AAA) to impose an academic boycott on Israel. The report cited a letter allegedly sent by 20 Israeli academics that the group said encouraged the members to vote in favor of the resolution.<ref>{{cite news |author=Lidar Gravé-Lazi |date=27 May 2016 |title=20 Israeli academics encourage BDS, Im Tirtzu says |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/20-Israeli-academics-encourage-BDS-Im-Tirtzu-says-455181 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |agency=JNS |date=26 May 2016 |title=Report: 20 Israeli Academics Encourage Anthropology Association's Boycott of Israel |url=http://www.algemeiner.com/2016/05/26/report-20-israeli-academics-encourage-anthropology-associations-boycott-of-israel/ |newspaper=[[Algemeiner Journal]]}}</ref> In light of the report, [[Yisrael Beiteinu]] Member of Knesset [[Oded Forer]] called an emergency session of the Knesset Education Committee<ref>{{cite news |author=Yair Altman |date=29 May 2016 |title=MK pushes for Knesset meeting on anti-Israel academic boycott |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=33987 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref> that was attended by MKs from both sides of the political aisle.<ref>{{cite news |date=8 June 2016 |agency=JNi.Media |title=Heated Debate at Education Committee Emergency Session on Pro-BDS Israeli Academics|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/heated-debate-at-education-committee-emergency-session-on-pro-bds-israeli-academics/2016/06/08/|newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]]}}</ref>
=== Israeli involvement in Israeli Apartheid Week === In 2016 Im Tirtzu released a report stating that a number of Israeli citizens and organizations were among the participants in the annual [[Israeli Apartheid Week]]. The report named [[Zochrot]] and individuals including [[Ilan Pappe]], [[Uri Davis]] and [[Jeff Halper]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Im Tirzu report exposes Israelis behind 'Apartheid Week' |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=32471 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref>
[[Guy Davidi]], producer of [[5 Broken Cameras]] who was also named in the report, responded by saying: "I strongly reject the attempt to present boycott actions taken by Israelis as an act of treason. In my view, boycotting and divesting are legitimate political actions that represent a positive way to protest -- a positive alternative to violent action, which I strongly condemn. It is the right of every person to choose to boycott certain products if they don't accept the origin or the way the product is manufactured."<ref>{{cite news |author=Yair Altman |date=16 March 2016 |title=Im Tirzu report exposes Israelis behind 'Apartheid Week' |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=32471 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref>
=== Nakba Harta campaign === In May 2011, with the approach of [[Nakba Day]], Im Tirtzu launched a campaign accompanied by a 70-page booklet titled "Nakba Harta" in Hebrew (נכבה חרטא), translated by ''The Jerusalem Post'' as "Nakba BS", and titled "Nakba Nonsense" in English.<ref name=jp20110513/><ref name="Nakba Nonsense"/> The booklet describes the [[1948 Palestinian exodus]], called ''Nakba'' by [[Palestinians]], as "a lie that threatens to drown us like a tsunami" and attempts to discredit what Im Tirtzu regards as "a narrative of myths and lies dealing with the teaching of the founding of the State of Israel".<ref name=jp20110513>{{cite news |title= Im Tirtzu launches campaign against 'myths' of the Nakba |url=http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Im-Tirtzu-launches-campaign-against-myths-of-the-Nakba | newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=13 May 2011 |author=Ben Hartman |author2=Lahav Harkov |accessdate=15 May 2011 |quote=As Palestinians in the West Bank and Arab Israelis inside the Green Line plan to commemorate 'Nakba Day' on 15 May, the right-wing student group Im Tirtzu has launched a campaign to discredit what it says is a narrative of myths and lies dealing with the teaching of the founding of the State of Israel.}}</ref><ref name="Nakba Nonsense">{{cite web |author=Erez Tadmor |author2=Erel Segal |title=Nakba-Nonsense |url=https://imti.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/%D7%A0%D7%9B%D7%91%D7%94-%D7%97%D7%A8%D7%98%D7%90-%D7%90%D7%A0%D7%92%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%AA.pdf |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}<!--Hebrew URL; English document --></ref> On 15 May 2011, dozens of Im Tirtzu activists gathered outside the offices of [[UNRWA]] in Jerusalem holding signs and chanting, "They expelled, they attacked, they lost."<ref>{{cite news |last=Eli |first=Yossi |title=פעילי אם תרצו מפגינים מול משרדי אונר"א נגד יום הנכבה |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/HP_487.html |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]] |date=15 May 2011 |language=Hebrew |trans-title=Tens of Im Tirtzu activists protest outside UNRWA offices against Nakba Day |accessdate=15 May 2011 |quote=עשרות פעילי תנועת "אם תרצו" מפגינים מול משרדי אונר"א, סמוך לגבעת התחמושת בירושלים תחת הכותרת "נכבה חארטה" בסמוך ומניפים שלטים כנגד יום הנכבה והאו"ם וקוראים: "הם גרשו, הם תקפו ,הם הפסידו". |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110511193033/http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/HP_487.html |archivedate=11 May 2011 }}</ref>
In 2016, Im Tirtzu set up a 15-foot-tall inflatable Pinocchio doll across from the Nakba ceremony at [[Tel Aviv University]] in order to "emphasize the lie of the Nakba."<ref>{{cite news |author=Dov Lieber |date=15 May 2016 |title=Nakba rally faces right-wing protest at Tel Aviv University |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/nakba-rally-faces-right-wing-protest-at-tel-aviv-university/ |publisher=[[The Times of Israel]]}}</ref>
=== Support for IDF soldiers === Im Tirtzu has acted in a number of ways to support IDF soldiers:
* In March 2010, the "Azad" restaurant in Haifa refused to serve IDF soldiers claiming that "the uniform does not serve the atmosphere or the place". In response, Im Tirtzu protested outside the restaurant and even assisted the soldiers in filing a lawsuit. The Haifa supreme court ruled that this was an act of severe discrimination against IDF soldiers and required the restaurant owners to pay the soldiers a sum of 5,000 NIS.<ref>{{cite news |author=Jonathan Halley |date=2 February 2011 |title=המסעדה שסירבה לשרת חייל – תשלם לו |language=he |trans-title=The restaurant that refused to serve a soldier will pay him |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART2/207/309.html |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=2 February 2011 |title=Haifa Restaurant Azad to Pay Soldier NIS 5000 |url=http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Haifa-restaurant-Azad-to-pay-soldier-NIS-5000 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref> * During [[Operation Protective Edge]], clothing and food products donated by the public were sent through Im Tirtzu to IDF soldiers.<ref name="walla.co.il">{{cite news |date=22 July 2014 |title=תרומה ממלכתית: יאיר נתניהו למען החיילים |trans-title=State contribution: Yair Netanyahu for the soldiers | url=http://celebs.walla.co.il/item/2768042 |publisher=[[Walla!]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Netanyahu's Son Volunteers with Anti-NIF NGO |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183298 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]] |date=24 July 2014}}</ref> Im Tirtzu also initiated a petition for filing [[United Nations Human Rights Council|UNHRC]] complaints against [[Hamas]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Ronen |first1=Gil |title=Hundreds of Sderot Residents File UNHRC Complaints against Hamas |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184049 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]] |date=14 August 2014}}</ref> * Im Tirtzu supports IDF reservists.<ref>{{cite news |author=Amit Barak |date=18 April 2013 |title=להסדיר מהר את המענק ללוחמי המילואים| |language=he |trans-title=quickly arranging the grant for the reserves |url=http://news.walla.co.il/item/2634289 |publisher=[[Walla!]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite AV media |title=עמית ברק בהעולם הבוקר - לוחמים נגד מנהלי מאבק הפראיירים |language=he |trans-title=Amit Barak in the morning - fighters against the managers of the struggle of the suckers |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fea0C82K8Bc |via=YouTube}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=26 October 2009 |title=Committee Rejects College Credit for Reserve Duty |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/173206 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref> The organization also provides individual assistance to reservists<ref>{{cite news |author=Itamar Fleischmann |date=24 September 2011 |title=התמורה למילואים: ביטול ההנחה בארנונה |language=he |trans-title="Im Tirtzu": Regulate the status of reserve soldiers |url=http://www.mynet.co.il/articles/1,7340,L-4125700,00.html |publisher=[[Ynet]]}}</ref> and advocates for reserve soldiers to receive preferential grants.<ref>{{cite news |author=Amit Barak |date=6 February 2013 |title=סדר יום מועדף למילואימניקים |language=he |trans-title=Preferred daily schedule for reservists |url=http://www.israelhayom.co.il/site/newsletter_opinion.php?id=10650|newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Avi Etgar |date=2 February 2013 |title="אם תרצו": להסדיר את מעמד חיילי המילואים |language=he |trans-title=Im Tirtzu: Regulate the status of reserve soldiers |url=http://www.iba.org.il/bet/?entity=906616&type=1&topic=0&page=|publisher=[[Reshet Bet]]}}</ref> * Im Tirtzu held a rally in support of [[Haredi Judaism|Haredi]] soldiers and against the incitement they were experiencing from the Haredi community.<ref>{{cite news |date=20 June 2013 |title=בירושלים הפגינו לתמיכה בחרדים המתגייסים לצה"ל |language=he |trans-title=Demonstrating in Jerusalem to support the Haredi enlisting in the IDF |url=http://www.iba.org.il/bet/?type=1&entity=938628 |publisher=[[Reshet Bet]]}}</ref>
=== Work with minorities === Im Tirtzu has advocated for minorities in Israel to join the Israeli military. The Forum for Drafting the Christian Community and its founder Father [[Gabriel Naddaf]] have worked closely with Im Tirtzu to encourage and promote the safety of [[Christianity in Israel|Christian Israelis]] who wish to perform IDF service.<ref>{{cite news |author=Elhanan Miller |date=27 June 2013 |title=In Arab Israel, a battle over Christian conscription |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/in-arab-israel-a-battle-over-christian-conscription/|publisher=[[The Times of Israel]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Father [[Gabriel Naddaf]] |date=29 March 2015 |title=It's hard to be a Christian in Israel, but not because of prejudice |url=http://www.jpost.com/Christian-News/Its-hard-to-be-a-Christian-in-Israel-but-not-because-of-prejudice-395467 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref> Father Naddaf is a frequent guest speaker at Im Tirtzu events and sits on their Public Council.<ref>{{cite web |title=Public Council |url=https://imti.org.il/en/about-us/council/ |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> Other Israeli Arabs who promote the integration of minorities in Israeli society have received awards from the movement.<ref>{{cite news |date=31 March 2016 |agency=JNi.Media |title=Rightwing Israeli Group Awards Zoabi for Advocacy on Behalf of Israel [video]|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/rightwing-israeli-group-awards-zoabi-for-advocacy-on-behalf-of-israel-video/2016/03/31/|newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]] |accessdate=19 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=[[Roy Arad|Roy "Chicky" Arad]] |date=28 December 2014 |title=איך "ערביה טובה" מנסה לשכנע את מתפקדי הבית היהודי לבחור בה |language=he |trans-title=How a "good Arab" tries to convince members of The Jewish Home to choose her |url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/news/elections/.premium-1.2523282 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |accessdate=19 January 2017}}</ref>
Im Tirtzu has also organized social activities with Israeli minorities, including distributing clothing and toys in [[Bedouin]] kindergartens and organizing meetings and tours in [[Druze]] villages.<ref>{{cite news |author=Boaz Wolinitz |date=18 October 2010 |title=פעילי "אם תרצו" חילקו צעצועים לילדי הבדואים |language=he |trans-title=Im Tirtzu activists distributed toys to Bedouin children |url=http://news.walla.co.il/item/1745116 |publisher=[[Walla!]]}}</ref> Following an act of vandalism against Jerusalem's [[Dormition Abbey]], in which vandals spray-painted anti-Christian slogans, Im Tirtzu activists arrived for a solidarity visit. Im Tirtzu CEO Matan Peleg stated: "[We] see this as an act that is at its very core both anti-Zionist as well as anti-Israeli, an act which dangerously threatens all of the Israeli society."<ref>{{cite news |author=Benjamin Glatt |date=18 January 2016 |title=Im Tirzu Movement Shows Solidarity with Defaced Jerusalem Abbey |url=http://www.jpost.com/Christian-News/Im-Tirzu-movement-shows-solidarity-with-defaced-abbey-441918 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
In 2015, a new parliamentary caucus to encourage minorities to join the army was created based on the idea of Im Tirtzu. The opening ceremony of the caucus was attended by MKs from the right, center, and left.<ref>{{cite news |author=Ariel Ben Solomon |date=14 October 2015 |title=New parliamentary group created to encourage minorities to join army |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/New-parliamentary-group-created-to-encourage-minorities-to-join-army-424945 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
In 2016, Im Tirtzu's fourth annual Zionist Conference for Human Rights centered around the integration of minorities, featuring speeches from Deputy Minister [[Ayoob Kara]], Father [[Gabriel Naddaf]] and other Israeli Arabs.<ref>{{cite news |author=Dov Lieber |date=11 December 2016 |title=PA ministers secretly hope there won't be Palestinian state, deputy minister claims |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-ministers-pleading-there-wont-be-palestinian-state-deputy-minister-claims/ |publisher=[[The Times of Israel]] |accessdate=5 January 2017}}</ref>
=== Program for Zionist Thought === In 2012, Im Tirtzu inaugurated its first Program for Zionist Thought, a serious of lectures given by prominent Israeli figures and personalities. The program is featured at [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem|Hebrew University]], [[Tel Aviv University]], Ben-Gurion University, [[University of Haifa]], [[Bar-Ilan University]], and [[Ariel University]].
Some of the speakers include Nobel Prize laureate [[Robert Aumann]], [[Caroline Glick]], [[Nitsana Darshan-Leitner]], Father Gabriel Naddaf, [[Ben-Dror Yemini]], [[Mordechai Kedar]], Major General [[Yaakov Amidror]], former MK [[Einat Wilf]], Rabbi [[David Stav]], Yoram Ettinger, and Ran Baratz.<ref>{{cite web |title=Program for Zionist Thought |url=http://imti.ravpage.co.il/pzt |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Jordan Scope |date=3 March 2015 |title=מרצים מוחים על סמינר ש"אם תרצו" מעבירה באוניברסיטאות: "התוכנית אינה אקדמית" |language=he |trans-title=Lecturers protest seminar that Im Tirtzu gave at universities: 'The program isn't academic' |url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/news/education/.premium-1.2579028 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref>
The program is the largest Zionist academic extra-curricular program in Israel.<ref name="jpost.com"/>
=== Hebron tours === In 2016 Im Tirtzu began to organize student tours of Hebron together with the [[Committee of the Jewish Community of Hebron]].<ref>{{cite news |date=1 December 2016 |agency=JNi.Media |title=Breaking the Silence: Teaching Hebron's Real Jewish History to Young Israelis |url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/jewish-news/breaking-the-silence-teaching-hebrons-real-jewish-history-to-young-israelis/2016/12/01/ |newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]]}}</ref>
According to Im Tirtzu CEO Matan Peleg, the tours are aimed to provide an answer to the tours of Hebron given by left-wing NGO [[Breaking the Silence (non-governmental organization)|Breaking the Silence]], which he dubs "de-legitimization and lies".<ref>{{cite news |author=Shakked Auerbach |date=24 March 2017 |title=The Right Angle: A Nationalist Group Takes Israelis on a Tour of Hebron |url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.779062 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref>
=== Ten year anniversary conference === In September 2017 Im Tirtzu held a conference celebrating ten years of activity. Hundreds of activists and supporters participated in the event, which featured a keynote speech from Speaker of the Knesset [[Yuli-Yoel Edelstein]] and video-recorded congratulatory messages from Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]], Defense Minister [[Avigdor Lieberman]], Education Minister [[Naftali Bennett]], Justice Minister [[Ayelet Shaked]], Jerusalem Mayor [[Nir Barkat]], and a number of other ministers, members of Knesset, and cultural figures.<ref>{{cite web|title="Im Tirtzu" Celebrated a Decade of Activity|url=http://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/502095|website=Israel Hayom|accessdate=23 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The Minister of the State of Israel and the Prime Minister Congratulate Im Tirtzu|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i6yrEVsG0Jo|website=YouTube}}</ref>
=== Campaign against Jenin, Jenin movie director Mohammed Bakri === {{undue|section|date=December 2017}} In 2012, Im Tirtzu organized a campaign against Israeli-Arab actor [[Mohammed Bakri]] who was slated to appear in [[Federico Garcia Lorca]]'s ''[[The House of Bernarda Alba]]'' at [[Tel Aviv]]'s Tzavta Theater. Im Tirtzu objected to Bakri because of his involvement in the film ''[[Jenin, Jenin]]''. In a ''[[Haaretz]]'' opinion piece, Im Tirtzu chairman Ronen Shoval called ''Jenin, Jenin'' an antisemitic [[blood libel]] "unprecedented in its fierceness" and referred to Bakri as a "sophisticated enemy". Shoval accused the Tzavta Club of offering a platform to "an inciter and a liar".<ref>{{cite news |last=Shoval |first=Ronen |authorlink=Ronen Shoval |title=מגיניו של בכרי |url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/opinions/1.1641903 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=15 February 2012 |language=He |trans-title=Bakri's defenders |accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Behind the curtain of a right-wing campaign against an Israeli-Arab actor |author=[[Michael Handelzalts]] |url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/culture/leisure/behind-the-curtain-of-a-right-wing-campaign-against-an-israeli-arab-actor-1.410100 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=31 January 2012 |accessdate=31 January 2012}}</ref>
== Criticism of New Israel Fund & foreign government funded NGOs ==
=== New Israel Fund === In 2010, Im Tirtzu published a document<ref name="israelbehindthenews.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.israelbehindthenews.com/library/pdfs/NIFGoldstone.pdf |title=The influence of New Israel Fund organizations on the Goldstone Report |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> and launched a campaign in the Israeli media that said there were connections between organizations supported by the New Israel Fund and the [[United Nations Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict]] (also known as the Goldstone Report). Im Tirtzu said that 92 percent of all Israeli testimonials in the report came from NIF funded organizations.<ref>{{cite news | url= http://www.haaretz.com/the-new-israel-fund-for-deepening-the-jewish-arab-rift-1.263120 |title= The New Israel Fund for Deepening the Jewish-Arab Rift| author= Israel Harel | date=11 February 2010 |work=[[Haaretz]] | accessdate = 7 September 2017 }}</ref> The campaign included "vilifying" NIF chairwoman [[Naomi Chazan]] as an agent of Hamas and Iran<ref name="Hedges" /> and the diffusion of posters caricaturing her with a horn strapped by a string on her forehead (in Hebrew, the word for "horn" also means "fund"),<ref name=horn>{{cite news | author = Esti Ahronovitz | title = Fighting for Israel's soul | newspaper=[[Haaretz]] | url = http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/fighting-for-israel-s-soul-1.374700 |date = 22 July 2011}}</ref> and a caption reading ''Naomi-Goldstone-Chazan.''<ref name="Hedges" >[[Chris Hedges]],[https://books.google.com/books?id=Ow85DgAAQBAJ&pg=PT138 ''Death of the Liberal Class,''] Hachette UK, 2010 p.151.</ref> According to [[Ron Kampeas]] ([[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]) Im Tirtzu's report said 16 NIF affiliated groups comprised 14 percent of all sources for the Goldstone report, while stating in a separate section that these constitute 92 percent of Israel-based negative reporting in the Goldstone report; some reporting had incorrectly confused the two separate figures and accused Im Tirzu as being inaccurate.<ref>{{cite web|title=Breaking down the Im Tirtzu report on New Israel Fund|url=https://www.jta.org/2010/02/10/news-opinion/israel-middle-east/breaking-down-the-im-tirtzu-report-on-new-israel-fund|website=JTA}}</ref>
As a result of the report there were calls in the Knesset to investigate the NIF and its operational arms in Israel.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Glick|first1=Caroline |authorlink=Caroline Glick |title=Column One: The NIF and the next war|url=http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Columnists/Column-One-The-NIF-and-the-next-war|newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> [[Benny Begin]], a cabinet minister at the time, characterized the allegations Im Tirtzu published as "lies" in a radio interview.<ref>{{cite news |author=Menachem Rahat |date=4 February 2015 |title=ד"ר בגין ומיסטר בני |language=he |trans-title=Dr. Begin and Mr. Benny |publisher=[[News1]] |url=http://www.news1.co.il/Archive/003-D-99669-00.html}}</ref> [[Abe Foxman]] said it was "absurd to blame Goldstone on the NIF".<ref>{{cite news |title=Knesset Slimers Retreat After Foxman Slams Defamation of New Israel Fund |author=[[J.J. Goldberg]] |date=5 February 2010 |newspaper=[[The Forward]] |url=http://forward.com/opinion/125089/knesset-slimers-retreat-after-foxman-slams-defamat/}}</ref>
Chazan claimed that, in her eyes, the campaign was directed against democracy itself.<ref name=horn/> The executive director of the [[Association for Civil Rights in Israel]], Hagai El-Ad, denied Im Tirtzu's allegations.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/opinion/pins-in-the-goldstone-voodoo-doll-1.290274 | author = Hagai El-Ad | title=Pins in the Goldstone voodoo doll | date = 13 May 2010 | newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref> [[Gideon Levy]], writing in ''Haaretz'', likened Im Tirtzu's campaign against NIF to fascist tactics.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/opinion/im-tirtzu-hides-behind-respectable-mask-of-zionism-1.262891 | author = [[Gideon Levy]] | title=Im Tirtzu hides behind respectable mask of 'Zionism' | date = 7 February 2010 | newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref> [[Gershon Baskin]], a columnist in ''The Jerusalem Post'', spoke out about the newspaper's decision to cancel Naomi Chazan's column and accused Im Tirtzu of using an "anti-Semitic motif" as part of a "witch-hunt" that "is reminiscent of the darkest days of McCarthyism".<ref name=jp-dark>{{cite news |date=9 February 2010 |url=http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Columnists/A-dark-day-for-democracy |title=A dark day for democracy |last=Baskin |first=Gershon |authorlink=Gershon Baskin |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |agency=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]] |accessdate=28 February 2010}}</ref> That poster was called "style ''Der Stürmer''" by the Facebook group "Im Tirzu - fascists" and was charged for libel by "Im Tirtzu". Judge Refael Yaakobi accepted the characterization of Im Tirtzu's poster as being similar in style to that of the Nazi party's newspaper, writing in the court's decision, "examining that publication and the source for comparison reveals that indeed there is truth in the matter."<ref>{{cite web |author=Oren Persico |date=7 September 2013 |url=http://www.the7eye.org.il/77493 |title=לא לסטריליות: שופט המחוזי דחה בפסק דין את רוב תביעת הדיבה של אם-תרצו וקרא לצדדים להפסיק את המשפט |language=he |trans-title=Unsterile: District judge rejected the verdict of Im Tirtzu's libel suit and called on the parties to stop the trial |publisher=[[HaAyin HaShevi'it]]}}</ref>
During [[Operation Pillar of Defense]], Im Tirtzu published an open letter in American Jewish newspapers addressed to the New Israel Fund chair. The letter gave examples of NIF funded organizations that Im Tirtzu said accused Israel of war crimes, and asked if the NIF agrees with their accusations.<ref>[http://israelbehindthenews.com/an-open-letter-to-the-new-israel-fund/9139/ An Open Letter to the New Israel Fund], Israel Behind the News, Media Reprints, 14 December 2012</ref> The NIF rebutted Im Tirtzu's charges, stating, "Not one of the human rights organizations Im Tirtzu attacks accused Israel of war crimes in the recent Gaza action." NIF also quoted [[Avichai Mandelblit]], the IDF's Chief Military Advocate General during Operation Cast Lead: "The organizations are a conduit for getting information on very important matters so that IDF activity is normative.... I'm trying to get at the truth and they really help us do that. Our cooperation with B'tselem [A NIF-supported group] stands out. They help us to speak with witnesses, to investigate complaints ... with all of the criticism from these organizations on us, their goal is to get to the truth."<ref name=nif20121213>{{cite web |title=Fact Sheet following Im Tirtzu Ad Blitz |url=http://www.nif.org/news-media/press-releases/fact-sheet-following-im-tirtzu-ad-blitz/ |publisher=[[New Israel Fund]] |date=13 December 2012}}</ref>
=== Foreign Agents campaign === In December 2015, Im Tirtzu launched a campaign calling Israeli left-wing and human rights organizations that receive funding from foreign entities as "foreign agents".<ref>{{cite web |title=Foreign Agents Report|url=https://imti.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/Foreign-Agents-Report-2.pdf|publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Zionist NGO: Leftist groups sabotaging Israel 'from within'|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=30425|newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref> It released a video depicting the heads of these organizations as foreign agents encouraging terrorist attacks; the [[Anti-Defamation League]] criticized the video as "hate speech;"<ref>{{cite news |date=18 December 2015 |title=ADL slams right-wing 'foreign-backed moles' video |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/adl-slams-right-wing-foreign-backed-moles-video/ |publisher=[[The Times of Israel]]}}</ref> a lawsuit against Im Tirtzu for incitement to violence was dismissed after the Attorney General determined that the video was urging the Israeli public to support MK [[Yoav Kisch]]'s "foreign agent bill".<ref>{{cite news |author=Gideon Allon |author2=Shlomo Cesana |date=18 December 2015 |title=17 MKs back bill labeling left-wing NGOs as foreign 'plants' |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=30527|newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Shlomo Piotrokovsky |date=24 January 2016 |title=Im Tirzu video won't be probed for 'incitement' |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/206937 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref> They also made a Facebook post calling a number of Israeli artists "cultural foreign agents". Following criticism, Im Tirtzu apologized and CEO Matan Peleg decided to suspend himself over the decision to upload the post.<ref>{{cite news |date=31 January 2016 |title=Im Tirtzu head suspends self over 'culture mole' campaign|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/im-tirtzu-head-suspends-self-over-culture-mole-campaign/|publisher=[[The Times of Israel]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Gil Ronen |date=31 January 2016 |title=Im Tirtzu head suspends himself |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/207315 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref>
=== HaMoked === In 2016 Im Tirtzu released a report claiming that the Israeli NGO [[HaMoked]] received over 15 million NIS from European governments and has submitted nearly 60 petitions to the Supreme Court from mid-2014 to 2016 on behalf of 48 families of Palestinian terrorists responsible for the murder of 50 people.<ref name="JPost NGO receives">{{cite news |author=Lidar Gravé-Lazi |date=13 February 2017 |title=Human Rights NGO Receives NIS 15m. From Europe |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Human-Rights-NGO-receives-NIS-15m-from-Europe-481451|newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
HaMoked declined to comment on the report.<ref name="JPost NGO receives" />
In response to the report, MK Oded Forer submitted a bill that would require organizations that receive the majority of their funding from foreign governments to declare their funding sources on every document submitted to the court.<ref>{{cite news |author=Jonathan Lis |date=13 February 2017 |title=הצעת חוק: עמותות שעיקר מימונן ממדינות זרות יידרשו להצהיר על כך בפני בג"ץ |language=he |trans-title=Bill: Organizations That Receive the Majority of Their Funding From Foreign Governments Will Need to Declare Such in Front of the High Court |url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/news/politi/1.3849973 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref>
=== Zochrot === Im Tirtzu released a report ahead of 2017's International Holocaust Remembrance Day detailing Germany's funding of the NGO [[Zochrot]], which works to "promote Israeli Jewish society's acknowledgement of and accountability for the ongoing injustices of the Nakba and the reconceptualization of Return as the imperative redress of the Nakba".<ref>{{cite web |title=Our Vision |url=http://zochrot.org/en/content/17 |publisher=[[Zochrot]]}}</ref>
According to the report, the Government of Germany had provided over 1,100,000 shekels ($290,000) to Zochrot from 2012 to 2016, which is used by Zochrot to engage in "anti-Israeli" activities including screening its "Film Festival on Nakba and the Right of Return" on college campuses during "Israeli Apartheid Week", promoting an "iNakba" smartphone application, and accusing Israel of "ethnic cleansing".<ref>{{cite news |date=25 January 2017 |agency=JNi.Media |title=Outrage: Germany to Observe Holocaust Remembrance Day while Funding Anti-Israel NGO |url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/outrage-germany-to-observe-holocaust-remembrance-day-while-funding-anti-israel-ngo/2017/01/25/ |newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]]}}</ref>
Im Tirtzu contacted the German Ambassador to Israel over the funding, yet received no response.<ref>{{cite news |author=David Rosenberg |date=27 January 2017 |title='Germany dishonoring the memory of the murdered Six Million' |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/223966 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref>
=== Machsom Watch === In May 2011 the organization called on Attorney-General [[Yehuda Weinstein]] to launch a criminal investigation into the operations of [[Machsom Watch]] (an NIF funded organization) for allegedly violating an [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] order prohibiting Israelis from entering the Palestinian village of [[Awarta]].<ref name="JPost Im Tirtzu calls">{{cite news |last=Katz |first=Yaakov |authorlink=Yaakov Katz (journalist) |title= Im Tirtzu calls for criminal investigation of Machsom Watch | url= http://www.jpost.com/Defense/Im-Tirtzu-calls-for-criminal-investigation-of-Machsom-Watch |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]| date = 2 May 2011 | accessdate = 15 May 2011 | quote = Im Tirtzu, a self-described Zionist extra-parliamentary group, has asked Attorney-General Yehuda Weinstein to open a criminal investigation against activists from Machsom Watch who allegedly entered the Palestinian village of Awarta last month in violation of an IDF order.}}</ref> About a week before the [[Shin Bet]] (Israel Security Agency) revealed the identities of the murder suspects for the [[Itamar attack]], senior Machsom Watch activist, Raya Yaron, was photographed hugging the mother of one of the men. Yaron said many other human rights organizations had also visited the village.<ref name="JPost Im Tirtzu calls"/>
=== Peace Now === In May 2012 [[Peace Now]] filed a police complaint that said Im Tirtzu activists had impersonated Peace Now activists and waved Palestinian flags during [[Jerusalem Day]] celebrations in what was reported as a presumed attempt to portray them as Palestinian sympathizers. They described Im Tirtzu as an "extremist movement" that, together with "extreme Islamic movements on the Arab side", they claimed would "drag us to a religious war steeped in blood". Im Tirtzu accused Peace Now of "impersonating an Israeli organization while operating with backing from foreign countries in order to give the Temple Mount to Palestinian Authority" and said freedom of speech gave them the right to ridicule Peace Now's positions.<ref>{{cite news |last=Potter |first=George |title= Peace Now cries foul on Palestinian flag wavers | url= http://www.timesofisrael.com/cops-called-on-flag-wavers/ | publisher=[[The Times of Israel]] | date = 21 May 2012 | quote = Peace Now cries foul on Palestinian flag waversLeft-wing group files complaint with police, claims right-wing Im Tirtzu activists impersonated it in Jerusalem Day parade | accessdate = 21 May 2012}}</ref>
=== National service in foreign governments funded NGOs === In 2016 Im Tirtzu issued a report stating that at least seven foreign government funded organizations that it deemed "anti-Israel" are eligible to receive [[Sherut Leumi]] (National Service) positions.<ref>{{cite news |author=Yair Altman |date=27 October 2016 |title=National service slots for 6 left-wing groups under review |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=37441 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Jonathan Lis |date=30 August 2016 |title=New Bill Aims to Limit State-funded Volunteers at Israeli Left-wing NGOs |url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.739296 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref>
In response to the report, MK [[Amir Ohana]] introduced a bill in cooperation with Im Tirtzu<ref>{{cite news |author=Lahav Harkov |date=12 December 2016 |title=Ban on National Service at Foreign-Funded NGOs Clears Hurdle |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Politics-And-Diplomacy/Ban-on-national-service-at-foreign-funded-NGOs-clears-hurdle-475098 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref> that was supported by Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]],<ref>{{cite news |author=Yair Altman |date=31 October 2016 |title=Knesset mulls nixing national service in foreign-funded bodies |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=37549 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref> which aimed to cancel national service positions in groups that receive the majority of their funding from foreign governments.
The bill was later passed into law by the Knesset in a vote of 40–12.<ref>{{cite news |author=Udi Shaham |date=22 March 2017 |title=Knesset Passes Law Forbidding National Service in Left-Wing NGOs |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Knesset-passes-law-forbidding-natl-service-in-foreign-funded-NGOs-484916 |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
=== Israeli organizations with UN advisor status === In 2015 Im Tirtzu released a report titled "Activity of Israeli Organizations with Advisor Status to the United Nations, Against Israeli Policy",<ref>{{cite web |title=Activity of Israeli Organizations with Advisor Status to the United Nations, Against Israeli Policy |url=https://imti.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/Activity-of-Israeli-Organizations-with-Advisor-Status-to-the-United-Nations-Against-Israeli-Policy.pdf |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref> which claims that three Israeli NGOs use their U.N. advisor to promote anti-Israel sentiments in the United Nations.
According to the report, [[Adalah]], [[Ittijah]], and the [[Israeli Committee Against House Demolitions]] encourage the U.N. to accuse Israel of international law violations. These three organizations declined to comment on the report.<ref>{{cite news |author=Shlomo Cesana |author2=Gideon Allon |date=16 June 2015 |title=3 Israeli groups operate against Israel within UN, study finds |url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=26233 |newspaper=[[Israel Hayom]]}}</ref>
=== UN Fact Finding Mission on the 2014 Israel–Gaza Conflict === Following the release of the findings by the "United Nations Fact Finding Mission on the 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict", Im Tirtzu released a report detailing the use by the UN of research by Israeli NGOs in the report.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Israeli Organizations That Enable the UN Report|url=https://imti.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/%D7%94%D7%90%D7%A8%D7%92%D7%95%D7%A0%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%A9%D7%9E%D7%9B%D7%A9%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%90%D7%AA-%D7%93%D7%95%D7%97-%D7%94%D7%90%D7%95%D7%9D.pdf |publisher=Im Tirtzu}}</ref>
According to the report, the UN report contained 72 references to reports by B'tselem, 8 references to Adalah, 8 references to Breaking the Silence, 12 references to HaMoked: Center for the Defence of the Individual, and 5 references to Yesh Din.<ref>{{cite news |date=23 June 2015 |title=Revealed: Israeli Leftist NGOs' Major Input into UN Gaza Repor |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/197141 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Akiva Lem |date=23 June 2015 |title=דו"ח של האו"ם: ישראלים נגד ישראל |language=he |trans-title=UN Report: Israelis Against Israel |url=http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-4671468,00.html |publisher=[[Ynet]]}}</ref>
=== Jerusalem === Ahead of 2016's [[Jerusalem Day]], Im Tirtzu released a report claiming that the Palestinian organization Human Rights and International Humanitarian Law Secretariat transfers millions of dollars to Israeli NGOs in order to delegitimize Israel and "obscure Israeli sovereignty in Jerusalem". According to the report, the Human Rights and International Humanitarian Law Secretariat acts as an independent organizations that manages donations from Denmark, Sweden, Switzerland and Holland and then transfers them to pro-BDS Palestinian and Israeli NGOs.<ref>{{cite news |author=Eric Bender |date=5 June 2016 |title=דוח אם תרצו: "מיליונים מועברים לעמותות הפועלות לחלוקת ירושלים" |language=he |trans-title=Im Tirtzu Report: Millions Are Being Transferred to Organizations Working to Divide Jerusalem |url=http://www.maariv.co.il/news/politics/Article-544388 |newspaper=[[Maariv]]}}</ref>
Sarit Michaeli, the spokesperson for B'Tselem – one of the NGOs named in the report as receiving funds – said "this is a recycled lie by Im Tirtzu. This money actually comes from Switzerland, Holland, Denmark and Sweden. This organization transfers the funds from the donating countries and deals with the bureaucracy of the transfer. The organization itself does not determine who receives the funds."<ref>{{cite news |author=Eric Bender |date=5 June 2016 |title=דוח אם תרצו: "מיליונים מועברים לעמותות הפועלות לחלוקת ירושלים" |language=he |trans-title=Im Tirtzu Report: Millions Are Being Transferred to Organizations Working to Divide Jerusalem |url=http://www.maariv.co.il/news/politics/Article-544388 |newspaper=[[Maariv]]}}</ref>
== Funding == In 2010, Im Tirtzu received funding from the following sources:<ref>{{cite news |title=Major Israeli businesses helped quadruple donations to right-wing Im Tirtzu movement |author=[[Uri Blau]] |url=http://www.haaretz.com/weekend/magazine/major-israeli-businesses-helped-quadruple-donations-to-right-wing-im-tirtzu-movement-1.404637 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=30 December 2011 |accessdate=31 December 2011}}</ref> *The [[Azrieli Group]], a shareholder in [[Bank Leumi]] and LeumiCard, which also owns 13 malls throughout the country and a controlling share in the [[Sonol]], [[Tambour (company)|Tambour]] and Supergaz companies and is behind the [[Azrieli Center]] in [[Tel Aviv]] *[[Leo Schachter]], Israel's second-largest exporter of processed diamonds, headed by Elliot Tannenbaum *Keren Segal Leyisrael, a fund headed by Jerusalem businessman Yotam Bar-Hama *The Forum for Religious Zionism, an organization registered in 2010 in the name of Zvi Soibel, former director of the [[Bnei Akiva]] yeshiva in [[Kfar Haroeh]].
Under [[John Hagee]]'s management, [[Christians United for Israel]]<ref>Faydra L. Shapiro, [https://books.google.com/books?id=0_W7CgAAQBAJ&pg=PA102 ''Christian Zionism: Navigating the Jewish-Christian Border,''] [[Wipf and Stock Publishers]], 2015 p.102.</ref> was a funder of Im Tirtzu but discontinued the funding on the grounds that Im Tirtzu "misrepresented its focus" by claiming that their work focused on "Zionist education" rather than "political" activity according to a spokesperson for the Evangelical organization.<ref name="jpHagee">{{cite news |author=Gil Shefler |date=23 August 2010 |url=http://www.jpost.com/Jewish-World/Jewish-News/John-Hagee-to-cut-Im-Tirtzu-funding |title=John Hagee to cut Im Tirtzu funding |work=[[The Jerusalem Post]]}}</ref>
According to [[Uri Blau]], in an [[Haaretz]] investigation Im Tirtzu, though highly critical of foreign governmental funding for 'leftist' Israeli NGOs, is itself the beneficiary of substantial donations from two American organisations closely associated with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.<ref>Uri Blau, [https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-group-slamming-israeli-ngos-foreign-funding-got-1m-from-u-s-donors-1.5487652 'Firebrand Anti-leftist Group, Which Slams Foreign Funding of Israeli NGOs, Received Over $1M From U.S. Donors,'] [[Haaretz]] 23 June 2017.</ref>During the 2015 election, Shining City, a U.S. [[front organization|front group]], contributed 3.7 million shekels (about 1 million U.S. dollars) to Im Tirtzu. Rabbi Aryeh Lightstone, the alleged leader of Shining City, now serves as senior adviser to U.S. ambassador to Israel [[David M. Friedman]]. According to Im Tirzu, most of its donors are Israelis, but the group is "pleased to find private donors from around the world as well (individuals and private foundations)" except those that are from a "foreign state entity or foundations that promote delegitimization of Israeli society".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.815979 |title=U.S. Ambassador's Adviser Ran 'Dark Money' Nonprofit That Donated $1M to Right-Wing Israeli Group |first=Uri |last=Blau |authorlink=Uri Blau |date=6 October 2017 |work=Haaretz |accessdate=7 October 2017 }}</ref>
== Leadership ==
The group was founded in 2006 by [[Ronen Shoval]], who also served as its chairman until his retirement in 2013, and Erez Tadmor, who was a group spokesperson until his retirement in 2011.
Following Ronen's retirement, Matan Peleg was elected as Im Tirtzu's chairman.<ref>{{cite news |date=29 December 2013 |title= 96 שנה למות אבשלום פיינברג צויינו באזכרתו |language=he |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART2/535/115.html |trans-title=Memorial for 96 years to Avshalom Feinberg's death |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]}}</ref> Peleg was the founder of the Im Tirtzu branch in Haifa and the head of the northern branch of the movement.<ref>[http://imti.org.il/docs/P188/?ThisPageID=809 "A letter to the rector of Haifa University"], Im Tirtzu {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201214853/http://imti.org.il/docs/P188/?ThisPageID=809 |date=1 February 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=6 May 2011 |url=http://www.karmel.co.il/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=17469&Itemid=12 |title=אם תרצו תיקח חלק ביום הזיכרון בעוספיה |language=he |trans-title=Im tirtzu will take part in the memorial-day event In Isfiya |publisher=Carmel Portal}}</ref> After Erez's retired, Matan replaced him in the role of missions coordinator.<ref>{{cite news |author=Uzi Baruch |date=7 December 2013 |url=http://www.inn.co.il/News/News.aspx/266631 |title=דנון: לעצור ההסתה של הח"כים הערבים |language=he |trans-title=Danon: Stop the incitement of Arab Mks |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]}}</ref> Alon Schwartzer was elected as head of the policy department alongside Matan.<ref>{{cite AV Media |date=9 January 2014 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MKAbXkqs580 |title=הקרן לישראל חדשה מאחורי מחאת המסתננים של 2014 - גלי ישראל |language=he |trans-title=New Israel Fund infiltrators behind protests of 2014 - Galei Yisrael |publisher=Im Tirtzu |via=YouTube}}</ref>
Matan Peleg suspended himself in January 2016 in the wake of an Im Tirtzu campaign against Israeli artists who supported human rights groups.<ref>{{cite news |title=Im Tirtzu director suspends self after controversy |date=31 January 2016 |publisher=[[The Times of Israel]] |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/im-tirtzu-director-suspends-self-after-controversy/}}</ref> Several months later in May 2016 Peleg returned to his role.<ref>{{cite web|title=After the "Cultural Implants" storm, Im Tirtzu CEO returns to his position|url=http://news.walla.co.il/item/2959173|website=Walla}}</ref>
== Reception ==
=== Likened to fascist groups === A [[Israeli New Shekel|NIS]] 2.6-million lawsuit was filed by Im Tirtzu against Israelis who had opened a [[Facebook]] page that suggested that Im Tirtzu was a Fascist group.<ref>{{cite news |author=Nir Hasson |date=12 February 2012 |url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/jerusalem-court-starts-debating-meaning-of-fascism-as-im-tirtzu-sues-activists-1.412357|title=Jerusalem Court Starts Debating Meaning of Fascism as Im Tirtzu Sues Activists |work=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref> A court in Jerusalem rejected some of the charges but found one person guilty of slander.<ref name="Hasson">{{cite news |last=Hasson |first=Nir |title=Rejecting bulk of libel suit, court rules Im Tirtzu movement can be likened to Fascism |url=http://www.haaretz.com/misc/article-print-page/.premium-1.545657 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=7 September 2013 |accessdate=7 September 2013}}</ref> In the verdict the Judge Refael Ya'akobi found that there were commonalities between the group and "certain principles of Fascism". He also stated that it is clear that the defendants are "bitter adversaries" of Im Tirtzu. He additionally wrote that the defendants do not imply a full identification Fascism with Im Tirtzu, but only some common lines. Finally the judge ruled that as Im Tirtzu emphasizes national aspects, the defendants can rely on the protections set in the law in order to be acquitted.<ref name="verdict">{{cite web |title=Verdict of the regional court |date=2 September 2013 |publisher=Jerusalem regional court |url=http://www.the7eye.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/%D7%A4%D7%A1%D7%A7-%D7%93%D7%99%D7%9F-%D7%90%D7%9D-%D7%AA%D7%A8%D7%A6%D7%95.pdf }}</ref><ref name="Hasson"/> and wrote also that there is truth in comparing the poster of "Im Tirtzu" against the New Israel Fund to the style of the Nazi newspaper ''[[Der Stürmer]]''.<ref name="verdict"/> The judge wrote: "One should view these publications (against Im Tirtzu) as saying and warning that past experience teaches that support of similar principles to those that Im Tirtzu supports ... brought harsh and bad results."<ref>{{cite news |author=Yair Altman |date=8 September 2013 |url=http://news.walla.co.il/item/2676349 |title=שופט מחוזי: "יש דמיון בין 'אם תרצו' לפאשיזם" |language=he |trans-title=District judge: There are similarities between Im Tirtzu and fascism |publisher=[[Walla!]]}}</ref> In September 2013, the judge rejected the majority of Im Tirtzu's arguments, and cleared four of the five defendants. One defendant, Roy Yellin, was found to have libeled Im Tirtzu by implying that the group shared the "Nazi race theory". However, the judge criticised Im Tirtzu for bringing the action in the first place, and postponed awarding any damages for the one successful claim.<ref name="Hasson"/><ref>{{cite web |last=Persico |first=Oren |date=7 September 2013 |title=לא לסטריליות |language=he |trans-title=No to sterility |url=http://www.the7eye.org.il/77493 |publisher=[[HaAyin HaShevi'it]] |accessdate=7 September 2013}}</ref> In February 2014, the court rejected Im Tirtzu's claim for damages, though it also rejected the defendants' claim for legal costs.<ref>{{cite news | author = Nir Hasson | title = Jerusalem court throws out Im Tirtzu's claim against left-wing activists | newspaper=[[Haaretz]] | date = 3 February 2014 | url = http://www.haaretz.com/misc/article-print-page/.premium-1.572078 }}</ref> Both Im Tirtzu and the defendants appealed to the high court. In the appeal, the high court declared the previous ruling as void and null and decided that the libel suit should have not been heard in court, since the main discussion is ideological, not juridical.<ref name="Blank">{{cite news|last=Blank|first= Cynthia |title=Supreme Court: Im Tirtzu Does Not Have 'Fascist' Traits|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/198181 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]]|date=15 July 2015 |accessdate=17 July 2015}}</ref>
In court proceedings, Professor [[Zeev Sternhell]], one of the world's leading experts on Fascism, testified that Im Tirtzu was "not worse than Fascism, it is that, more or less".<ref>{{cite web |author=Oren Persico |date=12 May 2013 |title=לנתח עם גרזן |language=he |trans-title= |url=http://www.the7eye.org.il/62652}}</ref> He also testified that Fascist principles "provide a basis for Im Tirtzu's operations".<ref name="ReferenceA"/> Sternhell analyzed the writings published by Im Tirtzu and observed expressions of fascist thinking in the writings of the group's founder. These include seeing the nation as an organic body, viewing the West as being weakened, and describing the situation in the country as an emergency situation that requires unusual action against "traitors".<ref name="haaretz.com">{{cite news |author=Nir Hasson |date=12 February 2012 |title=Jerusalem Court Starts Debating Meaning of Fascism as Im Tirtzu Sues Activists |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |url=http://www.haaretz.com/jerusalem-court-starts-debating-meaning-of-fascism-as-im-tirtzu-sues-activists-1.412357}}</ref>
Other court testimony documented that Im Tirtzu's founder admitted to drawing inspiration from German philosophers considered to have been precursors to Fascist ideology.<ref name="haaretz.com"/>
In 2016, Knesset Member [[Benny Begin]] also used the term "Fascist" to describe a campaign by the organization.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/misc/article-print-page/.premium-1.700085 "Netanyahu condemns ads attacking left-wing artists: My political opponents are not 'traitors'"], 28 January 2016, ''[[Haaretz]]''</ref>
=== Criticism === In 2009, Im Tirtzu's largest donor was the [[John Hagee]] Ministries (JHM) via the [[Christian Zionism|Christian-Zionist]] organization [[Christians United for Israel]] (CUFI). Im Tirtzu received US$100,000 from JHM and $34,000 from other sources. In 2010, ''The Jerusalem Post'' reported that JHM "expressed deep displeasure" with Im Tirtzu after its campaigns against the New Israel Fund and Ben-Gurion University and announced the cessation of its funding. A JHM spokesman said that Im Tirtzu "misrepresented its focus when they told us their mission was strictly Zionist education".<ref name="jpHagee"/>
The group's former spokesperson, Erez Tadmor, was found guilty of embezzling munitions from the Israeli military.<ref>{{cite news |author=Omri Maniv |date=24 February 2010 |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/54/ART2/067/985.html |title=מי אתה ארז תדמור? |language=he |trans-title=Erez Tadmor who are you? |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]}}</ref>
The organization was accused of acting in an Anti-Semitic fashion, including emulating Nazi propaganda, in its criticisms of U.S. Ambassador [[Martin Indyk]] and of the New Israel Fund.<ref>{{cite news |date=2 August 2013 |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.539319 |title=U.S. Peace Envoy Depicted as Puppet by Israeli Right-wing Group |work=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Oren Persico |date=7 September 2013 |title=לא לסטריליות |language=he |trans-title=No to sterility |url=http://www.the7eye.org.il/77493}}</ref>
[[Haaretz]] newspaper alleged that "Im Tirtzu has taken over political discourse in Israel, and injected into it the crazy idea of the internal enemy," and accused [[The Jewish Home]] party as "operating as the political arm of Im Tirtzu."<ref>{{cite web|title=Editorial Declaring War on Academia|url=http://www.haaretz.com/opinion/editorial/1.794974|website=Haaretz}}</ref>
=== Support ===
Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] has publicly endorsed Im Tirtzu.<ref name="youtube.com"/><ref>{{cite news |title=False equivalence in Israel |author=Noam Shelef |date=29 January 2016 |newspaper=[[The Jewish Journal of Greater Los Angeles|The Jewish Journal]] |url=http://jewishjournal.com/opinion/181749/}}</ref>
Im Tirtzu has been active on college campuses throughout Israel, and has received support from members of the Israeli Parliament and prominent Israeli writers and personalities.<ref name="haolam.de">{{cite news|title=Im Tirtzu's Third Annual Convention |url=http://www.haolam.de/index.php?site=dertag&id=5631 |newspaper=haOlam.de |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219095926/http://www.haolam.de/index.php?site=dertag&id=5631 |archivedate=19 December 2013 }}{{failed verification|date=April 2017|reason=The named article isn't at the archive page}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=[[Ben-Dror Yemini]] |date=20 August 2010 |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]] |title=שטיפת מוח אקדמית |language=he |trans-title=Academic Brainwashing |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/app/index.php?do=blog&encr_id=f2b4c1b55be76d1e6d7b777256ea0370&id=1565 |accessdate=8 January 2013}}</ref>
[[Arutz Sheva]] has described Im Tirtzu as the largest Zionist movement in Israel.<ref>{{cite news |title=European governments funding the defense of terrorists |date=16 August 2016 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]] |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/216478}}</ref>
In a 2012 Ministry of Culture and Education competition, Im Tirtzu won first prize for their video titled, "Zionism Without Jerusalem?" In a competition featuring almost 150 entries, Im Tirtzu's video won the most popular video, and was awarded a prize of 25,000 shekels.<ref>{{cite news |author=Emilie Grunzweig |date=17 July 2012 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |title=Culture Ministry to award NIS 25,000 to Im Tirtzu for short film |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/culture-ministry-to-award-nis-25-000-to-im-tirtzu-for-short-film-1.451558 |accessdate=8 January 2013}}</ref>
